title: Secure Data Management Life Cycle for Government Big-Data Ecosystem: Design and Development Perspective
theoretical_background: Data life cycle models; Security models
research_description: This paper presents a mixed-methods approach to developing a secure data management life cycle for the government’s big data ecosystem. The study combines theoretical analysis with simulations and experiments to design a secure architecture that addresses data confidentiality, integrity, and availability challenges. It focuses on improving both the technical and organizational aspects of data security within public administration.
research_results: The study proposes a hybrid approach combining ECC with AES encryption to enhance data confidentiality and security, improving data management in public administration.
future_research: Future research could focus on the practical implementation of the secure data management life cycle in specific government sectors.
